news.title: Mystery surrounds Seán Gallagher’s departure from company run by Áras hopeful Gareth Sheridan
news.summary: There is mystery around why Seán Gallagher, the former presidential candidate, resigned as chairman and director of Nutriband, the company run by Gareth Sheridan, who is now seeking a nomination to run for the Áras in November.

news.title: Two teens stabbed as they slept in car in ‘planned attack’ on Dublin street
news.summary: Gardaí are following a definite line of inquiry into an early morning double stabbing incident that happened in Dublin’s south inner city.

news.title: ‘Gaza journalist Anas al-Sharif and I grew up on the same streets – his killing is an attack on truth itself’
news.summary: The news of Anas al-Sharif’s killing hit me like a physical blow. A journalist with Al Jazeera, Anas was not my friend in the everyday sense – we never shared coffee, never walked the streets of Gaza together. But he was my neighbour.

news.title: Former Rose of Tralee and Ryan Tubridy’s fiancée Clare Kambamettu set to judge this year’s competition
news.summary: Former Rose of Tralee Clare Kambamettu has been confirmed as a judge of this year’s competition.

news.title: Gaeltacht summer tradition under threat as colleges struggle to cope with exodus of mná tí
news.summary: It’s a tradition enjoyed by generations of Irish teenagers – going to the Gaeltacht without their parents for a few happy weeks in the summer, being immersed in the Irish language and, hopefully, leaving with a lifelong grá for Gaeilge.

news.title: Brian Cox: ‘People snipe at me but I’m too old, too tired and too talented to care’
news.summary: We are in Dundee, where it all began for Brian Cox. It’s at a different site now, but the Dundee Repertory Theatre is where he started his career as a 14-year-old “assistant to the stage manager’s assistant”. It was more than a job, at the time; it became his refuge.

news.title: ‘I’m a chartered accountant – here are 10 common mistakes that lead to small business failure’
news.summary: Setting up a small business takes courage, determination and preparation. Many business owners start out with a great idea, but face common financial pitfalls that get in the way of growth.

news.title: ‘My father left the family farm to us siblings. We all want to keep it – except one brother, who is the executor and has put it up for sale. Can we stop him?’
news.summary: Query:  Dear Mary Frances, my father died last year after a long illness and left the family farm and home to myself and my siblings.

news.title: ‘I became the lead singer in the world’s biggest Oasis tribute band after winning a karaoke competition down at my local pub’
news.summary: Since I was a young lad I have been obsessed with Oasis, and in particular Liam Gallagher. I remember my cousin coming back from a trip to the UK with a CD of Definitely Maybe and just listening to it in the family home over and over and being blown away.

news.title: Daniel McDonnell: Shelbourne look for cool heads to break new ground in a game that can change players’ lives
news.summary: The only thing guaranteed in Tolka Park tonight is tension and emotion, products of the natural energy that accompanies a game with life-changing potential.
